SEARCH
Package mygame.terminal

Class Reader

java.lang.Object
mygame.terminal.Reader
public final class Reader extends Object
Class for reading user inputs from the terminal. Provides methods for reading raw key input and prompting user for lines of text.

This class is a singleton, and should be accessed through getInstance().

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Reader getInstance()
      Gets a Reader instance. Returns null if one cannot be created, such as when the terminal emulator is not supported.
      Returns:
      a Reader object

    • readKey

      public Reader.Key readKey()
      Reads a keypress from the console.
      Returns:
      a Reader.Key, or null if it's not one of the recognized keys

    • readLine

      public String readLine()
      Reads an input line from the user.
      Returns:
      the string user enters.

    • prompt

      public <T extends Enum<?>> T prompt(String prompt, Class<T> options)
      Prompts the user for input until they enters a valid choice (case-insensitive), then returns the choice.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Enum type
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display to the user
      options - an Enum class of valid inputs
      Returns:
      the corresponding Enum to the user's input

    • prompt

      public boolean prompt(String prompt)
      Prompts the user a yes/no question.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display to the user
      Returns:
      true if the user answered yes, false otherwise
